channel.title: TravelgateX Documentation – TravelgateX
channel.description: Recent changes in TravelgateX on TravelgateX Documentation

item.title: Travelgatex: Overview
item.description:
This page provides an overview of the TravelgateX platform. GraphQL Gateway TravelgateX is the travel API completely based in GraphQL. Unlike many legacy XML Soap APIs, GraphQL enables each client to ask for and receive exactly the data that is needed. Learn more by reading our Learning GraphQL guides. Our Gateway is the only endpoint to access all of our APIs. It is written in NodeJS. This makes it fast, stable, secure, fault tolerant and load balanced between many datacenters from four different cloud providers: Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Hetzner and TotalUptime.
[...]

item.title: Travelgatex: Concepts
item.description: <a href="/travelgatex/concepts/common-resources/" class="card"> <div class="inner-card"> <div class="material-icons fa fa-users"></div> <div> <h3 class="text-headline">Common resources</h3> <p>Learn about common resources used in TravelgateX</p> </div> </div> </a> <a href="/travelgatex/concepts/quotas-limits/" class="card"> <div class="inner-card"> <div class="material-icons fa fa-balance-scale"></div> <div> <h3 class="text-headline">Quotas &amp; Limits</h3> </div> </div> </a> <a href="/travelgatex/concepts/request-headers/" class="card"> <div class="inner-card"> <div class="material-icons fa fa-plus-circle"></div> <div> <h3 class="text-headline">Request Headers</h3> <p>HTTP request headers required in all API requests</p> </div> </div> </a> <a href="/travelgatex/concepts/http-response-status-codes/" class="card"> <div class="inner-card"> <div class="material-icons fa fa-code"></div> <div> <h3 class="text-headline">Response status codes</h3> <p>HTTP response status codes indicate whether a specific HTTP request has been successfully completed</p> </div> </div> </a>

item.title: Travelgatex: Reference
item.description:
Our reference pages explain all aspects of our GraphQL schema. These pages are divided into the following sections: Schema: Explains how our Schema works and the two key operations: Queries and Mutations Objects: A complete list of all objects in our schema, their definitions, what fields they use and when they are mandatory. role=“alert”>We are currently building out examples for every Object page. Please send us a Pull request if you would like to see an example for a particular Object, or if you would like to share your own example with the TravelgateX community.
[...]

item.title: Travelgatex: Security
Travelgatex: Data Automation
item.description:
Bulk Data Automation Several of our TravelgateX API products use your data in order to perform tasks. For example, your application may use certain field names to describe rooms, hotel amenities, and rates. These need to be matched to field names for your suppliers. You can upload your data to our platform by: Uploading it via SFTP or Changing data via a mutation. You can decide what is the best way for you to get your updated data into our servers.
[...]

item.title: Travelgatex: FAQs
item.description:
What is TravelgateX? TravelgateX platform provides a single API endpoint for all of our API products. This makes it easy for you to integrate our full travel catalog and services into your applications (regardless of whether you are integrating to a website, mobile app, widget, or other interface). Instead of having to deal with REST APIs, you’ll be able to use full poser of GraphQL to interact with your data.
[...]
